issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.summary: Better Message on deletion of security group still in use

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Response to DeleteSecurityGroup not correct if group is in use

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Originally posted by Shashi on 2009-07-31 22:31:28.804568+00:00

Eucalyptus lets a security group to be deleted while it is still in use by an instance. EC2 throws an error "InvalidGroup.InUse: There are active instances using security group <security_group>". This seems incompatible with EC2 semantics.

*Update* 

Since this is an old bug, confirming what the behavior is when a user tries to delete a security group in-use by an instance/instances.  Want to confirm if we do error out the same way as AWS.
fields.summary: Security groups can't be deleted while still in use by an instance, but AWS EC2 Compatible message not returned
fields.environment:
*HA*

* 2 x CLC/Walrus
* 2 x CC
* 1 x SC
* 3 x NCs

comments.body:
Originally posted by Shashi on 2009-07-31T22:31:28.804568+00:00

Eucalyptus lets a security group to be deleted while it is still in use by an instance. EC2 throws an error "InvalidGroup.InUse: There are active instances using security group <security_group>". This seems incompatible with EC2 semantics.

Originally posted by graziano obertelli on 2012-03-13T23:12:52.481663+00:00

Confirmed as still present in 2.0.3.
Harold will check 3.1.2 to make sure this issue has been resolved.

We do not delete the security group, but we do not supply an AWS EC2 compatible response. {code} # euca-describe-instances i-A8F53BF7 RESERVATION r-40D54383 345590850920 delete-security INSTANCE i-A8F53BF7 emi-29433329 euca-192-168-55-106.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com euca-10-106-126-173.wu-tang.internal running admin 0 m1.small 2012-11-28T21:50:23.656Z enter-the-wu eki-30ED38F5 eri-2B47392B monitoring-disable euca-192-168-55-106.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com euca-10-106-126-173.wu-tang.internal instance-store # euca-delete-group delete-security --debug 2012-11-28
